server

Class MultiServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.MultiServer

  • public class MultiServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The MultiServer class represents the server designated for accepting requests coming from a client application. The client must connect to the server through the IP address and the port on which the latter is waiting for requests. The server will be waiting for a request until a client application sends it a new one. When a new request arrives, the server instantiates a new thread to handle a specific request and to supply the service the client is asking for. A thread ends its execution when the result of a request is communicated to the client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int PORT
      The port used by the server to accept communication from clients.

    • Field Detail

      • PORT

        private int PORT
        The port used by the server to accept communication from clients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiServer

        public MultiServer(int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs an instance of MultiServer class by setting information about server port. This method always executes run() to give server the opportunity to receive new requests from client applications.
        Parameters:
        port - a numeric combination representing server's port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs when handling a connection using sockets.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Represents the core of server activity. This method creates a ServerSocket's object that put the server in waiting state until a new client request arrives. When there is a pending request, a Socket-to-Socket connection is set up by creating a Socket's object which will be used to communicate the result of a request to a client application. Communication with a specific client is handled by a thread instantiated with the Socket's object when there is a new request. The server ends the execution when its activity is no longer required.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs when handling a connection using sockets.
        See Also:
        ServerSocket, Socket, ServerOneClient

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes a MultiServer's object and set its port to a specific value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if an I/O error occurs when handling a connection using sockets.
